A 20-year-old male presents with chronic constipation, headache and habitus, neuromas of tongue, medullated corneal nerve fibers and nodule of 2x2 cm size in left lobe of thyroid. This patient is a case of:
questions.explanation:
Parathyroid Adenoma Pancreatic NET (PGI) Pituitary Adenoma
  • MC endocrine abnormality(>98% of affected individuals) in MEN-1 is multiglandular parathyroid tumors.
  • Hyperparathyroidism is MC manifestation (cardinal sign of MEN-1 is parathyroid adenoma of multicentricity).
  • Hypercalcemia is first biochemical abnormality detected in MEN-1 and may precede the clinical onset of a pancreatic NET or pituitary neoplasm by several years.
  • Pancreatic NET is 2nd MC manifestation.
  • Nonfunctioning or that secrete pancreatic polypeptide are MC pancreatic NET in MEN-1.
  • MC functional NET in patients with MEN-1 gastrinoma followed by insulinoma.
  • MC increased pancreatic hormone: Pancreatic plypeptides>Gastrin>Insulin(PGI)
  • Prolactinoma is most common.
  • Diagnosed by increased prolactin (>200 mg/l) and MRI.

MEN-2A (Sipple syndrome MEN) Men-2B (MEN-3)
Components
  • Medullary carcinoma thyroid ·
  • Pheochromocytoma
  • Parathyroid hyperplasia or adenoma
  • Hirschprung’s disease
  • Cutaneous lichen amyloidosis
  • Medullary carcinoma thyroid ·
  • Pheochromocytoma
  • Intestinal ganglioneuromas
  • Mucosal neuromas
  • Megacolon
  • Marfanoid features
Defect
  • RET oncogene (Cysteine codon)
  • Chromosome:10
  • RET oncogene (tyrosin kinase domain)
  • Chromosome:10
Transmission
  • Autosomal dominant
  • Autosomal dominant

questions.text: A 50-year-old suffering from chronic alcoholism is admitted to the hospital. He has muscle tremors and hyperactive tendon reflexes. Serum magnesium is 1.8 mEq/L (normal 1.5–2.5 mEq/L). Concerning magnesium, which of the following statements is true?

options.label: B
options.text: Excess may cause a positive Chvostek’s sign (carpopedal spasm)

options.label: C
options.text: Deficiency is treated with parenteral bicarbonate

options.label: D
options.text: Symptoms are due to deficiency of magnesium

questions.correct_answer: D. Symptoms are due to deficiency of magnesium

questions.text: All of the following are true regarding myelofibrosis except:

A 4 year old boy is brought to the pediatrician by his mother due toabnormal behaviour. She reports that he does not respond to affection, does not smile, doesn’t want to play with other kids, spends most of his time alone with his toys. She also says that he is very particular about his toys, he always arranges them in a particular fashion and gets very agitated upon change. What is your diagnosis?

A middle-aged man presents with complaints of bilateral flank pain with progressive enlargement of the abdomen. He also gives a history of the sudden death of one of his adult family members . On ultrasonography, he is found to have multiple cysts on both kidneys . Which of the following would be the most common extra-renal involvement in this renal condition?
"Hegar's sign" can be elicited in:
Which of the following reflexes persists throughout life?
Fluorescent imaging:

options.label: B
options.text: has lower stability compared to radioisotopes

options.label: D
options.text: detects photon of a wavelength longer than X-ray

questions.correct_answer: B. has lower stability compared to radioisotopes

questions.text: A 65-year-old man with a history of hypertension and hyperlipidemia presents with an ulcerated lesion on his right lateral leg for several weeks (given in the image below). He occasionally has cramping in his calf when walking. His dorsalis pedis and posterior tibial pulses are not palpable. The ulcer has a punched out edge. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 35 years male presented to OPD with complain of mild pain abdomen. There is no history of fever, diarrhea, vomiting or any other GI symptom. He tells to doctor that he is suffering from this mild pain for last 6 months. O/E - He is normotensive, pulse = 72 bpm, no visible lymphadenopathy. All blood investigations were normal. CECT abdomen revealed suprarenal mass on Right side. A diagnosis of Adrenal Incidentaloma is made. Tumor is likely to be ?
questions.explanation:
1. Endocrine inactive tumors : 60-85%.
  2. Cortisol producing.
  3. Aldosterone producing.
  4. Pheochromocytoma : 5-10%.

questions.text: Identify the disorder depicted in the image:
The content of casein is maximum in ?
questions.explanation:
Animal Protein Total% Casein% Whey Protein% Fat% Carbohydrate%
Breast Milk 1.2 0.5 0.7 3.8 7.0
Cow Milk 3.5 2.8 0.7 3.7 4.8
Buffalo Milk 4.0 3.5 0.5 7.5 4.8

questions.text: A 76-year-old male patient presented with complaints of painful nodules on the back and upper limbs for several years . She reported the growth of some nodules and an increase in number over time. The patient is obese and has a BMI of 37 . On physical examination, skin-coloured subcutaneous nodules all over the upper limbs and on the back were found, as shown in the image below: Surgical removal of the painful nodules and anatomopathological examination was performed, which confirmed the proliferation of well-differentiated and uniform adipocytes sitting on a fibrovascular network . Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?
Which of the following maneuvers causes the depicted sign?
All of the following are features of Central Retinal Artery Oclusion Except:
Sign of Dance is:

options.label: A
options.text: Empty right iliac fossa in intussusception

options.label: B
options.text: Pincer shaped appearance in barium enema in intussusception

options.label: D
options.text: Passing of larger quantities of urine in hydronephrosis

questions.correct_answer: A. Empty right iliac fossa in intussusception

questions.text: What is the patient in the image suffering from?
Which of the following is false about Glomus tumor?

options.label: A
options.text: Most common benign tumor of middle ear

questions.text: Barcode finding on USG seen in:
A change is observed after stroking lesions on the skin of a person. The skin became swollen, itchy and red. This is seen in:
A 38-year-old female patient presents to the OPD with a productive cough and dyspnoea. The CT chest of the patient is given below. Which of the following findings is shown in the CT scan?
Identify the incorrect pair:
questions.correct_answer: D. Baumann’s angle – Congenital coxa vara

questions.text: Name the Presentation ?
questions.explanation:
Fetal presenting part Denominator
Vertex Occiput
Face Mentum
Brow Frontal eminence
Breech Sacrum
Shoulder Acromion

questions.text: A 40-year-old male patient presents to the medical department with pain in the lower back. He also complaints of bloody urine, nausea and vomiting. He tells the doctor about recurrent urination. His vitals are stable. Ultrasound of the abdomen shows a right renal stone. What is the most common renal stone, and how is it treated?

options.label: A
options.text: Hyper ureic renal stone treated with loop diuretics

options.label: B
options.text: Hypercalciuria renal stone treated with thiazide diuretics

options.label: C
options.text: Cysteine renal stones treated with spironolactone

options.label: D
options.text: Both hypercalciuric and cysteine renal stones

questions.correct_answer: B. Hypercalciuria renal stone treated with thiazide diuretics

questions.text: 70 year old male, with long standing history of right-sided nasal obstruction and progressively mounting right nasal cavity growth for the last four years, with occasional epistaxis and nasal itching. There was a friable slightly mobile, erythematous polypoidal mass filling the right nasal cavity on examination. The contralateral nasal cavity was normal. Which of the following is the causative pathogen of the depicted picture?

A patient presented in OPD with symptoms of anaemia, acute abdominal bleeding, tarry stool and vomiting with blood in it. Endoscopy shows strips of watermelon on stomach walls. Which of the following conditions leads to the following endoscopic appearance?

A 25-year-old male is brought to the emergency department due to a knife injury. The man was walking home when a thief tried to rob him. While the man attempted to escape, the robber hit his back with a knife. There is a 4cm wide lesion on the back of the patient , just adjacent to the vertebrae. The physician suspects that his injury spread to the spinal cord causing Brown-Sequard syndrome . Which of the following statements is correct regarding Brown-Sequard syndrome?

options.label: C
options.text: Ipsilateral loss of joint and position sense

questions.correct_answer: C. Ipsilateral loss of joint and position sense

questions.text: A 32-year-old man undergoes a distal pancreatectomy, splenectomy, and partial colectomy for a gunshot wound to the left upper quadrant of the abdomen. One week later he develops a shaking chill in conjunction with a temperature spike to 39.44°C (103°F). His blood pressure is 70/40 mm Hg with a pulse of 140 beats/min and his respiratory rate is 45 breaths/min. He is transferred to the ICU where he is intubated and a Swan-Ganz catheter is placed. Which of the following would be most consistent with this patient’s preintubation arterial blood gas measurement? pH Pa CO 2 Pa O 2 a. 7.31 48 61 b. 7.52 28 76 c. 7.45 40 77 d. 7.40 30 72 e. 7.40 48 94

A 40 year old man had multiple hypoesthetic mildly erythematous large plaques with elevated margins on trunk and extremities. His ulnar and lateral popliteal nerves on both sides were enlarged. What is your diagnosis?
A 25 year old man has pigmented macules over the palms, soles and oral mucosa. He also has anemia and abdominal pain. Which one of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Cushing syndrome Presents with lemon on sticks with hypertension and anemia.
Albright syndrome

McCune – Albright syndrome (MAS) consists of at least 2 of the following 3 features:

  1. Polyostotic fibrous dysplasia
  2. Café –au- lait skin pigmentation
  3. Autonomous endocrine hyperfunction (eg, gonadotropin – independent)
Peutz jeghers syndrome The lentigines in patients with Peutz-Jeghers syndrome are located primarily around the nose and mouth, on the hands and feet, and within the oral cavity. This is associated with hamartomatous polyps. During the first 3 decades of life, anemia, rectal bleeding, abdominal pain, obstruction, and/or intussusception are common complications in patients with Peutz-Jeghers syndrome.-
Incontinentia pigment The disease has a pediatric presentation Major criteria are (1) typical neonatal vesicular rash with eosinophilia; (2) typical blaschkoid hyperpigmentation on the trunk, fading in adolescence; and (3) linear, atrophic hairless lesions Minor criteria are (1) Dental anomalies (2) Alopecia, (3) wooly hair, and ( 4) abnormal nails.

questions.text: A patient comes to the ER with greenish discharge from the eye. He is a frequent contact lens user and complains of regular eye fatigue. On further examination, there is visible ‘bio-film’ formation in his cornea. Which of the following is the causative agent for this type of ulcer?
Which direction will the left upper lobe collapse on the CT of an elderly female patient who has CXR evidence of a left upper lobe collapse?
Most common organism responsible for acute bacterial prostatitis:

A 11-year-old boy with past medical history of sickle cell disease (homozygote form) comes to the pediatric emergency room with left upper abdominal pain, fever, and episodes of vomit-ing. He is complaining of previous episodes in the past that occurred after heavy meals. A chest x-ray shows the normal heart silhouette in the right chest. A routine abdominal ultrasound shows absence of a gallbladder in the right upper quadrant. The liver parenchyma is seen on the opposite side. Also, the radiologist calls you confused, indicating a thick-walled, fluid-filled cystic structure with echodense particles on the left side, which appears tender on pal-pation. A liver function test is normal except for an alkaline phospatase of 187. WBC is 17.6. What is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: The patient has constipation and should get an enema to clear out his fecal impaction from the left colon

options.label: B
options.text: Preventing a sickle cell crisis, the patient should be placed on additional nasal oxygen, copious hydration, pain medication, and maintaining a hematocrit of >28%.

options.label: C
options.text: In addition to preventing a sickle cell crisis, the patient seems to have acute cholecystitis and needs IV antibiotics followed by cholecystectomy

options.label: D
options.text: The patient has situs inversus totalis and cholecystectomy is contraindicated

questions.correct_answer: C. In addition to preventing a sickle cell crisis, the patient seems to have acute cholecystitis and needs IV antibiotics followed by cholecystectomy

questions.text: Name the Vertex position?

An 83-year-old male patient had osteoarthritis in the right knee for seven years, with no flexion contracture or high varus or valgus deformity. For the last three days, he started having extreme pain and underwent magnetic resonance imaging, which showed lesions in the medial femoral condyle cartilage in the weight-bearing region. The patient was scheduled for surgery and underwent total knee arthroplasty . Acute arterial occlusion is a rare complication following total knee arthroplasty. Which of the following is the clinical presentation of this complication?

The given image is useful in the diagnosis of a 50 year old male with decreased vision in his left eye. Slit-lamp biomicroscopy of the left eye revealed Vogt’s striae, stromal thinning, and a stromal scar.Identify the instrument:
In a noninflammatory, postmenopausal Pap smear, what percentage of the cells in the maturation index are superficial cells?

A 32-year-old woman presented to the physician's clinic with a complaint of thin whitish vaginal discharge for the past week. On physical examination, the discharge is seen and vaginal discharge sample is collected, and the examination findings are shown in the image below. Which of the following is the disease caused by the organism seen around the vaginal cells in the image?
A 7 year old child is brought with fever, colicky abdominal pain and non-blanching palpable purpuric rash on buttocks and back of legs. What is the probable diagnosis?

A 6 year old boy was brought by his parents to the clinic, who were anxious about the excessive increase in the size of the boy’s phallus, from the age of 1 ½ years if age. The bone age is 12 years. Which of the following instruments is useful in the diagnosis of this condition?
Name the following instrument:

A 15 year old boy with complaints of swelling at lower end of left femur, swelling has local local temperature raised, ill defined margins, variable consistency and dilated veins. On X-ray there is bony swelling from lower end of femur and there is Codman’s triangle (Periosteal Reaction) all the following are required for diagnosis EXCEPT:
Which one of the following statements about electrolytes in colon is correct:

options.label: A
options.text: Absorption of Na+ in the colon is under hormonal (aldosterone) control

options.label: B
options.text: Bile acids enhance absorption of water from the colon

options.label: C
options.text: Net absorption of HCO 3 - occurs in the colon

options.label: D
options.text: Net absorption of K + occurs in the colon

questions.correct_answer: A. Absorption of Na+ in the colon is under hormonal (aldosterone) control

questions.text: Severe acute malnourishment is defined as-

A 5-year-old boy presents to the clinic complaining of a lesion in his oral cavity, which looks like a frog’s belly. He is scheduled for elective surgery. During the surgery, the surgeon employs the following instrument. What is the name of this instrument?
When is the second polar body extruded ?
questions.correct_answer: D. At the time of fertilization

questions.text: A 62-year-old male presented to opd with complains of sudden onset palpitations and dizziness . He is a k/c/o COPD and developed a viral upper respiratory infection for which he was taking an over-the-counter decongestant. Shortly thereafter he started experiencing palpitations . O/E - Pulse = 150/ min. , Rhytm = regular, BP = 80/60 mm Hg. ECG was done which shows following findings. Likely diagnosis is ?
Identify the given image:

An obese male patient who is a known case of diabetes has presented with OPD with increased serum ferritin levels. Upon further investigations, it is found that he is a case of Non- alcoholic fatty liver disease. Which of the following is the most common cause of Non- alcoholic fatty liver disease?

A 65-year-old male patient undergoing an arthroscopic procedure on the right shoulder under general anaesthesia and an interscalene block in the sitting position develops bradycardia and hypotension during the intra-operative period. The interscalene block was performed using 20ml of 1% lidocaine with epinephrine. The most appropriate treatment is:
Which segment of the facial nerve lies near the oval window?
A 49-year-old female consults about hormone replacement therapy (HRT). The most compelling indication for starting HRT is:?

options.label: D
options.text: Control of vasomotor symptoms such as flushing

questions.correct_answer: D. Control of vasomotor symptoms such as flushing

questions.text: In nuclear cataract , there is discolouration due to urochrome pigments deposited in lens. Choose the correct order of pigmentation.
A 25-year-old woman is found to have an anterior neck mass. Her thyroid scan, shown below, exhibits findings that are consistent with which of the following disorders?
Elevated JVP is seen in all except?
In the resection of a stenotic area of the intestine in a patient with Crohn’s disease, the best approach is:

options.label: A
options.text: A resection margin of 2 cm from thegross disease.

options.label: B
options.text: A resection margin of 12 cm from the gross disease.

options.label: C
options.text: A resection margin 2 cm from the microscopic disease on frozen section.

options.label: D
options.text: A resection margin 12 cm from the microscopic disease on frozen section.

questions.correct_answer: A. A resection margin of 2 cm from thegross disease.
